snippet: New watered-down rules suggest banks are again dictating public policy in ways that could risk another crisis.
abstract: Editorial criticizes decision by committee of central bankers and regulators from more than two dozen countries, including United States, for watering down important rules meant to strengthen global financial system.
lead_paragraph: New watered-down rules suggest banks are again dictating public policy in ways that could risk another crisis.

headline.seo: A Step Backward in Bank Regulations
headline.main: A Step Backward in Bank Regulations
headline.print_headline: A Step Backward in Bank Regulations
